turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Gardens of Monticello.
turn.1: What did Thomas Jefferson do at the Gardens of Monticello?
turn.2: To complete his masterwork, Jefferson designed a pavilion to overlook his gardens and built four roads providing access to them.
turn.4: While Jefferson's gardens did provide his family with food, their primary purpose was to serve as his laboratory where he experimented with hundreds of different types of vegetables from all over the world.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: He was as meticulous in his experimentation as he had been with his design.
turn.8: He kept a garden book, titled the Garden Kalender, in which he documented every success and failure.
turn.9: What did he do when he failed?
turn.10: He logged the exact dates his seeds were initially planted.
turn.11: What other dates did he mark in his garden book?
turn.12: He also noted when leaves appeared and when the flowers blossomed.
